author: lvxing
content: https://rpc.dencun-devnet-12.ethpandaops.io  Hi, has this rpc problem been fixed? Recently, transactions sent through this rpc directly failed.

author: parithosh
content: RPC was being hammered by an explorer afaik. It should be fine now, give it a shot?

author: phillux__
content:
Hey ethereans, I have some questions about how eip4844 blobspace txns work in practice. I hope this is the right channel, lmk if there’s a better channel for this…

One part about getting a blob on-chain is that there are two transactions, one to get the blob and one to fill it. A few things about this I want to know:
- if I get a blob that is included, must it be filled with anything?
- if I get a blob that is included, and I want to fill it with data, can i procure the blob in one step, then fill it with data “later”? Even if it’s just a few seconds delayed within the window before the block is included on-chain?
- can I only get a blob in the next block, or can I get one in X blocks ahead? (Can I plan the exact slot/block this happens if so?)

author: rjected
content:
> One part about getting a blob on-chain is that there are two transactions, one to get the blob and one to fill it
I don't think this is correct, you just send a transaction with a blob attached. It cannot be filled, the blob _is_ the data

author: rjected
content:
to answer the questions:
1. blob == data that you care about, there is no fill step
2. everything happens in one step, you send `(transaction, blobs)`, it gets included in a block like any other transaction
3. refer to normal 1559 transaction / block inclusion - your blob tx may not be competitive enough to be included in the next block, or other blob txs may have a higher priority fee. There can be max 6 blob txs per block. If the validator for the slot is using mev-boost then maybe you could send the blob tx as a bundle to control when it is included.
